column4: can someone please explain to me why all the ubuntu networking config files and documentation refer to a command called "iface" when it's not available on my system?
can you link to the documentation that does that?
my edgy files /etc/network/interfaces also have that exact command in
is the proper driver for you're ethernet card loaded?
it is, and it shows in a modprobe ... it was cloned from an identical machine, on which it does work
are you running those commands with "sudo" in front to be root?
and do you get errors when running "sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart" or just "start"?
in chan just now ... SIOCSIFADDR: No such device
oh ok, and that's the only error? What type of card is it and what driver are you using?
can you pastebin the result from "sudo lspci" as well?
it's an onboard Intel pro card ... kernel driver e100
when you say you cloned the driver from another machine, what do you mean? You ghosted the whole hard drive, or just copied the driver, or what?
i ghosted the whole hard drive using g4u
and the ethernet card is the same?
does it show up at all in "sudo ifconfig"?
it shows up when I do ifconfig -a
ok, can you pastebin the full result of "sudo ifconfig -a" and what happens when you "sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart" and "sudo cat /etc/network/interfaces"
did you pastebin that stuff? If so give me the url to check it out
